channel.title: Smoke?
channel.description:
Series on smoking and health; approved by the American Cancer Society.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Audition tape
item.description: The pilot program for a projected series, intended for use in high schools, presenting information on smoking and health that may help young people make a rational decision about whether to smoke.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Smooth, mild and mellow
item.description: This program describes ways that cigarettes are promoted.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: What's the question?
item.description: This program asks the question of whether or not someone should commit to smoking.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Once burned, twice warned
item.description: This program focuses on the increased death rate connected to smoking.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Something to do with one's hands
item.description: This program describes some of the reasons behind why people smoke.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Pro and con
item.description: This program focuses on arguments for and against smoking.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: One in eight
item.description: This program focuses on studies that assess the health effects of smoking.
item.dc:creator: Carlson, Elizabeth
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure
